name: 2.Data Description
content:
Data Description


Dataset 1: HCP Engagement Prediction

  • Size: 3,226 rows × 12 columns
  • Purpose: Predict healthcare provider (HCP) engagement based on Social Determinants of Health (SDOH).

Columns:

  1. poverty_rate → % of population living below the poverty line
  2. racial_discrimination → Score indicating racial discrimination levels in the region
  3. housing_quality → Score for overall housing quality
  4. transportation_access → Score reflecting accessibility to transportation
  5. market_access → Measure of accessibility to markets and essential services
  6. hcp_engagement → Target variable: Numerical score for HCP engagement
  7. risk_surveillance → Score for effectiveness of risk monitoring/surveillance systems
  8. clinical_trial_design → Measure of availability/quality of clinical trials in the region
  9. practice_outreach → Score for outreach efforts by healthcare practices
  10. care_coverage → % or measure of population covered by healthcare services
  11. region → Geographical region (e.g., North, South, West)
  12. age_group → Age demographic (e.g., Child, Adult, Senior)


Dataset 2: Social Economic Prediction

  • Size: 16,130 rows × 12 columns
  • Purpose: Broader dataset covering socioeconomic metrics with similar features to Dataset 1.

Columns:

  1. poverty_rate → % of population living below the poverty line
  2. racial_discrimination → Score indicating racial discrimination levels in the region
  3. housing_quality → Score for overall housing quality
  4. transportation_access → Score reflecting accessibility to transportation
  5. market_access → Measure of accessibility to markets and essential services
  6. hcp_engagement → Target variable: Numerical score for HCP engagement
  7. risk_surveillance → Score for effectiveness of risk monitoring/surveillance systems
  8. clinical_trial_design → Measure of availability/quality of clinical trials in the region
  9. practice_outreach → Score for outreach efforts by healthcare practices
  10. care_coverage → % or measure of population covered by healthcare services
  11. region → Geographical region (e.g., North, South, West)
  12. age_group → Age demographic (e.g., Child, Adult, Senior)
